You guys, you should know that when you do a fresh install that all old files will be erased. If you want to keep pictures, music, movies, etc. then back them up to a flash drive or CD or whatever so you can re-install them when the new windows version is installed and ready. Also in my experience i use "Power ISO" to burn .iso files to a disc and I check the box "verify files written" and write it at the slowest possible speed. Many, many times problems get blamed on the guy who did all this hard work creating something great when it is only a mistake made by trying to burn the file to disk too quick and making errors. I know this from experience so what is 5 or 10 more minutes to be sure that you got the file burnt to your disc properly? You guys got to learn how to install drivers. All you have to do is go to the manufacturer's Web site of your computer, select "drivers and support downloads" then enter your computer model information and a list of driver downloads will appear for you to download and install for free. WOW, what more can you ask for?
